abstract: Queens Dist Atty Richard A Brown has been re-elected six times, most recently in November, and last time he faced opponent for office was in 1991; critics say Brown's long, unchallenged tenure is emblem of New York City's antiquated political machine, which is still force in borough.
lead_paragraph: Richard A. Brown, 83, has been re-elected to the district attorney’s job six times since 1991, with no opposition, and detractors say that is a sign of lingering machine politics in New York.

headline.main: Elections Are Easy for Queens Prosecutor; Critics Call This a Problem
headline.print_headline: Elections Easy for Queens Prosecutor; Critics Call This a Problem

snippet: Richard A. Brown, 83, has been re-elected to the district attorney’s job six times since 1991, with no opposition, and detractors say that is a sign of lingering machine politics in New York.
